terms.definition: A tool that generates a complete static website from source files, creating HTML pages at build time rather than dynamically serving content
A query language and runtime for APIs that allows clients to request exactly the data they need in a single request
A collection of third-party extensions that add functionality to a core platform or framework
Node Package Manager - the default package manager for JavaScript that allows developers to install and manage code libraries
Progressive Web App - a web application that uses modern web capabilities to deliver an app-like experience to users
A script that runs in the background of a web browser to enable features like offline functionality and push notifications
A JSON file that provides metadata about a web application, enabling it to be installed on devices like a native app
A styling technique where CSS styles are written within JavaScript code, allowing for component-scoped styling
A format that combines Markdown syntax with JSX components, allowing interactive elements within documentation
Search Engine Optimization - the practice of improving website visibility and ranking in search engine results
An XML file that lists all pages on a website to help search engines crawl and index content more efficiently
A technique where web pages are generated on the server before being sent to the browser, improving performance and SEO
A technique in Gatsby themes that allows developers to override or customize theme components by creating files with matching names
A development feature that updates code changes in the browser without requiring a full page reload
Data that provides information about other data, such as page titles, descriptions, and tags used for SEO and social sharing
